docs.abstract: Mr. Lauder, a billionaire and longtime Republican contributor, cast the effort as more aggressive than that of other Jewish advocacy groups, outlining plans to air television and radio ads.
docs.snippet: Mr. Lauder, a billionaire and longtime Republican contributor, cast the effort as more aggressive than that of other Jewish advocacy groups, outlining plans to air television and radio ads.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ronald S. Lauder, the cosmetics billionaire and president of the World Jewish Congress, is setting aside $25 million of his own money to start a new organization devoted to rooting out what he sees as the growing tide of anti-Semitism in American politics.

headline.main: Ron Lauder Pledges $25 Million for Campaign Against Anti-Semitism
headline.print_headline: Cosmetics Magnate Puts Anti-Semitism in Cross Hairs

docs.abstract: Calling himself the “retirement guy” and pitching a “Gray New Deal,” Mr. Buttigieg has crafted a message that resonates among older white Americans, helping him rocket past other candidates in some polls.
docs.snippet: Calling himself the “retirement guy” and pitching a “Gray New Deal,” Mr. Buttigieg has crafted a message that resonates among older white Americans, helping him rocket past other candidates in some polls.
docs.lead_paragraph: DENISON, Iowa — Pete Buttigieg likes a crisp white button-down — no fuss, no flash — and his favorite novel is by a man who died in 1941.

headline.main: O.K., Mayor: Why 37-Year-Old Pete Buttigieg Is Attracting Boomers
headline.print_headline: Why Buttigieg Is Scoring Big With the Boomers

docs.abstract: One day after former President Barack Obama cautioned against being out of touch with voters, Democratic candidates said there was a winner among them.
docs.snippet: One day after former President Barack Obama cautioned against being out of touch with voters, Democratic candidates said there was a winner among them.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONG BEACH, Calif. — The crowded Democratic field of presidential candidates grappled with President Barack Obama’s advice and legacy on Saturday, the day after the former president sounded an unusual public warning about moving too far left in the primary race.

headline.main: Too Far Left? Some Democratic Candidates Don’t Buy Obama’s Argument

byline.original: By Jennifer Medina and Lisa Lerer

docs.abstract: Former President Barack Obama, in an address to liberal donors, warned candidates not to go too far left and sought to calm those who were concerned about the state of the Democratic primary.
docs.snippet: Former President Barack Obama, in an address to liberal donors, warned candidates not to go too far left and sought to calm those who were concerned about the state of the Democratic primary.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Former President Barack Obama offered an unusual warning to the Democratic primary field on Friday evening, cautioning the candidates not to move too far to the left in their policy proposals, even as he sought to reassure a party establishment worried about the electoral strength of their historically large primary field.

headline.main: Obama Says Average American Doesn’t Want to ‘Tear Down System’
headline.print_headline: Obama Warns Contenders About Leaning Too Far Left

docs.abstract: Michael Harriot, who wrote a scathing essay about Mr. Buttigieg in The Root, said his goal was to point out that “the ignoring and whitewashing of the issues, and trying to remain appealing to moderate voters, does a disservice to the Democratic Party’s core constituency.”
docs.snippet: Michael Harriot, who wrote a scathing essay about Mr. Buttigieg in The Root, said his goal was to point out that “the ignoring and whitewashing of the issues, and trying to remain appealing to moderate voters, does a disservice to the Democratic P...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Mayor Pete Buttigieg of South Bend, Ind., whose lack of support among black voters poses an ongoing threat to his presidential candidacy, responded Tuesday to an outcry over eight-year-old comments he made about black students from poor neighborhoods struggling in school because they did not have proper role models.

headline.main: Pete Buttigieg Responds to Uproar Over Past Comments on Minority Students
headline.print_headline: Buttigieg Addresses Past Comments on Black Students

byline.original: By Reid J. Epstein and Sydney Ember

docs.abstract: No Democrat in modern times has won the party’s nomination without claiming majorities of black voters, the most crucial voting bloc in South Carolina and an array of delegate-rich states.
docs.snippet: No Democrat in modern times has won the party’s nomination without claiming majorities of black voters, the most crucial voting bloc in South Carolina and an array of delegate-rich states.
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has 154 endorsements from current or former black or Hispanic elected officials. Senator Kamala Harris has 93. Senator Bernie Sanders has 91. Senator Cory Booker has 50. Senator Elizabeth Warren has 43.

headline.main: Pete Buttigieg Is in Bad Shape With Black Democrats. Here’s Why.
headline.print_headline: Surging in Iowa, Buttigieg Struggles to Connect With Black Voters

docs.abstract: Abortion rights groups responded to our story, claiming political momentum heading into 2020.
docs.snippet: Abortion rights groups responded to our story, claiming political momentum heading into 2020.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. I’m Lisa Lerer, your host, along with my colleague Elizabeth Dias, our religion reporter.

byline.original: By Lisa Lerer and Elizabeth Dias

docs.abstract: Joe Biden leads with black voters, and Elizabeth Warren and Bernie Sanders are making better inroads with younger ones than Kamala Harris and Cory Booker. In interviews, voters rejected the idea that racial representation equated to change.
docs.snippet: Joe Biden leads with black voters, and Elizabeth Warren and Bernie Sanders are making better inroads with younger ones than Kamala Harris and Cory Booker. In interviews, voters rejected the idea that racial representation equated to change.
docs.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — Chyna Hester knew what she was supposed to say.

headline.main: Black Voters to Black Candidates: Representation Is Not Enough
headline.print_headline: Black Voters’ Plea to Black Candidates: Do More

docs.abstract: Kamala Harris is out of the race. We diagnosed her messaging missteps with our colleague Astead W. Herndon.
docs.snippet: Kamala Harris is out of the race. We diagnosed her messaging missteps with our colleague Astead W. Herndon.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. I’m Nick Corasaniti, your host on Tuesdays for our coverage of all things media and messaging.

docs.abstract: As he steps up his efforts in Iowa, Mr. Sanders is using a traditional media platform to try to bring new voters into the political system to support him.
docs.snippet: As he steps up his efforts in Iowa, Mr. Sanders is using a traditional media platform to try to bring new voters into the political system to support him.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Bernie Sanders’s campaign plans to spend more than $30 million on TV advertising alone in the first four presidential nominating states and California, according to several people familiar with the strategy, a financial show of force that also suggests he needs to reach outside the traditional sphere of Democratic primary voters and caucusgoers for support.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Is Flush With Cash. Here’s How He Plans to Spend It.
headline.print_headline: Sanders, Flush With Cash, Plans a TV Ad Blitz

byline.original: By Reid J. Epstein and Sydney Ember
